Strong cities were the key to Canada's economic success before the pandemic, frontline city services are helping fight the pandemic and saving thousands of lives right now, and cities will be absolutely crucial to Canada's economic recovery from #COVID19.

Our message is simply this: we have serious problems, it is a national problem affecting all Canadian cities and we simply can't afford to have constitutional or intergovernmental wrangling standing in the way of cities getting the help they need now.

To be effective nationwide, this funding should be straightforward, direct, flexible and timely. That means a single transfer that municipalities can use as needed — with no matching funds required from provinces. This transfer will need to be supplemented in some cases.

I join my Big City Mayor colleagues and the @FCM_Online in calling for at least $10 billion in emergency federal operating funding in 2020. We are turning to the federal government on this because it is time for national leadership to help cities.
We need immediate federal funding—so we can keep people safe, and then be ready to drive Canada’s economic recovery.

This is a national challenge that needs to be taken seriously—a threat to our national economy and our national economic recovery. Intergovermental and jurisdictional wrangling can’t stand in the way of the support cities need now.
We’re calling for decisive national leadership to help cities during these unprecedented times – and provinces will need to step forward too.

That's why you are hearing from Mayors across the country this week and you will hear me today call on the federal government to step forward and lead in the effort to help cities just as they have led in supporting so many other players in our economy.

All cities, Toronto included, are facing a financial crisis. We are doing everything we can to protect our residents now and in the post-COVID months ahead, but we also know cities can’t run deficits, can’t raise taxes right now, and can’t cut services. We will need help.
